{"data":[{"id":29,"title":"PlanetScale review: Horizontally scalable MySQL in the cloud","meta_k":"SQL mySQL","meta_d":"SQL mySQL","date":1689278400,"img":"cloud_computing_binary_rain_thinkstock_469846534_3x2-100740698-large.webp","description":"Vitess-powered PlanetScale scales to hold as much data as you need, but is currently limited to a single cluster.","text":"<p style=\"margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 16px; margin-left: 0px; font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" color:=\"\" rgb(78,=\"\" 66,=\"\" 66);=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.125rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.875rem;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">PlanetScale is a MySQL-compatible, serverless database platform powered by Vitess, which is a database clustering system for horizontal scaling of MySQL (as well as Percona and MariaDB). Vitess also powers Slack, Square, GitHub, and YouTube, among others. The Slack deployment of Vitess has about 6,000 servers; the current largest Vitess deployment has about 70,000 servers.<\/p><p style=\"margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 16px; margin-left: 0px; font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" color:=\"\" rgb(78,=\"\" 66,=\"\" 66);=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.125rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.875rem;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">MySQL databases are easy to use when you are just starting out, but when your database grows (for example, after a year or so of operations) you can easily run into its limits. The most commonly used MySQL database engine, InnoDB, has a maximum page size of 64 KB, which limits the row size. InnoDB also has a maximum tablespace size of 256 TB, which limits the size of a table.<\/p><p style=\"margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 16px; margin-left: 0px; font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" color:=\"\" rgb(78,=\"\" 66,=\"\" 66);=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.125rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.875rem;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">Vitess helps you to scale a MySQL database by allowing you to shard it. A shard is a horizontal (row-wise) partition of the data. Once the database is sharded, Vitess takes care of routing queries to the appropriate MySQL instance based on the shard key field value, which lets you keep application changes to a minimum. Vitess also creates much lighter-weight connections than MySQL, allowing it to support thousands of connections, and it has configurable rules to rewrite queries that would hurt database performance.<\/p><div id=\"editorialfakesidebardiv\" class=\"fakesidebar fakesidebar-auto\" style=\"font-size: 1.0625rem; line-height: 1.625rem; margin: 0px 0px 1rem; overflow-x: auto; max-width: 620px; color: rgb(78, 66, 66); font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\"><aside id=\"fsb-4044\"><h4 style=\"color: rgb(34, 34, 34); margin: 1.625rem 0px 16px; max-width: 620px; padding: 0px; font-size: 1.225rem; line-height: 1.4375rem;\">[&nbsp;<u><a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3627792\/how-to-choose-a-cloud-database.html\" style=\"color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">Also on InfoWorld: How to choose a cloud database<\/a><\/u>&nbsp;]<\/h4><\/aside><\/div><p style=\"margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 16px; margin-left: 0px; font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" color:=\"\" rgb(78,=\"\" 66,=\"\" 66);=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.125rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.875rem;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">PlanetScale is basically Vitess on MySQL in the cloud, with a cloud user interface, plus a command line interface (CLI) that you can run on your own machine. The CLI can control almost everything in your PlanetScale instance, from creating databases down to manipulating data. Data manipulation depends on the Oracle MySQL client, which also needs to be installed on your machine.<\/p><p style=\"margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 16px; margin-left: 0px; font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" color:=\"\" rgb(78,=\"\" 66,=\"\" 66);=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.125rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.875rem;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">As many as 10 distributed database products compete with PlanetScale, depending on whether you count NoSQL databases. Cloud-specific examples include&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3209719\/review-google-cloud-spanner-takes-sql-to-nosql-scale.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">Google Cloud Spanner<\/a>&nbsp;(relational),&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3261548\/cosmos-db-review-database-for-a-small-planet.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">Azure Cosmos DB<\/a>&nbsp;(multi-model NoSQL), Amazon DynamoDB (key-value and document), and&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/2989831\/review-amazon-aurora-rocks-mysql.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">Amazon Aurora<\/a>&nbsp;(relational). Vendor examples include&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3246628\/cockroachdb-review-a-scale-out-sql-database-built-for-survival.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">CockroachDB<\/a>&nbsp;(relational),&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3489459\/faunadb-review-fast-nosql-database-for-global-scale.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">Fauna<\/a>&nbsp;(relational\/serverless),&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3256064\/review-neo4j-graph-database-supercharges-graph-analytics.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">Neo4j<\/a>&nbsp;(graph),&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3300619\/review-mongodb-takes-on-the-world.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">MongoDB Atlas<\/a>&nbsp;(document),&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3298539\/datastax-review-cassandra-made-faster-and-easier.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">DataStax Astra<\/a>&nbsp;(wide-column), and&nbsp;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.infoworld.com\/article\/3430716\/couchbase-review-a-smart-nosql-database.html\" style=\"font-family: sans-serif; font-weight: 400; color: rgb(239, 76, 35); text-decoration: none;\">Couchbase Cloud<\/a>&nbsp;(document). Follow those links to my reviews of these products.<\/p><h2 style=\"color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" margin:=\"\" 1.625rem=\"\" 0px=\"\" 16px;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.8rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.2em;=\"\" text-align:=\"\" start;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">PlanetScale setup<\/h2><p style=\"margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 16px; margin-left: 0px; font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" color:=\"\" rgb(78,=\"\" 66,=\"\" 66);=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.125rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.875rem;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">Getting started with PlanetScale is about as easy as it could be. The default is the free developer plan, which doesn\u2019t require a credit card \u2014 just a name, email address, password, and eventually an organization name. If and when you exceed the limits of the developer plan, you can add a credit card and switch to the scaler plan.<\/p><aside class=\"nativo-promo nativo-promo-1 smartphone\" id=\"\" style=\"overflow: hidden; margin: 0px 0px 16px; max-width: 620px; color: rgb(78, 66, 66); font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\"><\/aside><p style=\"margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 16px; margin-left: 0px; font-family: museo-sans, \" helvetica=\"\" neue\",=\"\" helvetica,=\"\" arial,=\"\" sans-serif,=\"\" sans-serif;=\"\" color:=\"\" rgb(78,=\"\" 66,=\"\" 66);=\"\" padding:=\"\" 0px;=\"\" font-size:=\"\" 1.125rem;=\"\" line-height:=\"\" 1.875rem;=\"\" max-width:=\"\" 620px;=\"\" background-color:=\"\" rgb(255,=\"\" 255,=\"\" 255);\"=\"\">You also need to install the PlanetScale CLI on your development machine, as well as the MySQL client shell.
